name: overindulgent
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
allowing someone to have more of something enjoyable than is good for them: In part, the researchers pointed to overindulgent adults for raising children to believe they are "special" no matter what they do.
allowing yourself to have too much of something enjoyable, especially food or drink: He recalls seeing an overindulgent colleague arriving back at his office after lunch still holding a glass.
More examplesFewer examplesExperts at Cambridge University have blamed the behaviour crisis on overindulgent parents.Not so much child-friendly as simply overindulgent, the facilities include an astonishing range of activities, from tubing to mini-Skidoo driving, and a funpark for five-year-old snowboarders.The first peas of the year, tossed with a slightly overindulgent knob of butter, is a high point of early summer.The film is an overindulgent two and a half hours - even longer than the director's other fine two-plus-hour works.
